Trailer Finder Documentation¶

Welcome to the documentation for Trailer Finder. This document will guide you through the usage, installation, configuration, and various modules of the project.

Introduction¶

Trailer Finder is a Python-based application designed to help you find and manage movie trailers from various sources. It integrates with popular tools like Radarr and Sonarr, provides translation capabilities, and uses YouTube for trailer fetching.

Installation¶

To install Trailer Finder, you can use the following steps:

# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/trailer-finder.git

# Navigate to the project directory
cd trailer-finder

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt

Configuration¶

Configuration is managed through the config.yaml file. Ensure you edit this file to match your environment and preferences.

Usage¶

To start using Trailer Finder, run the following command:

python main.py

Modules¶

Trailer Finder is composed of several modules:

Modules:

  • Logger Module
    • RESET
    • RED
    • GREEN
    • WARN
    • WHITE
    • Logger
  • radarr module
    • radarr()
  • sonarr module
    • sonarr()
  • translator module
    • Translator
  • utils module
    • Utils
  • youtube_dl module
    • YoutubeDL
  • main module
    • main()

  • logger: Handles logging functionality throughout the application.

  • radarr: Integrates with Radarr for movie management.

  • sonarr: Integrates with Sonarr for TV show management.

  • translator: Provides translation capabilities for different locales.

  • utils: Contains utility functions used across the application.

  • youtube_dl: Fetches trailers from YouTube using youtube-dl.

Troubleshooting¶

If you encounter any issues, refer to the following tips:

  • Ensure all dependencies are installed by running pip install -r requirements.txt.

  • Check the configuration file config.yaml for any misconfigurations.

  • Look at the logs generated by the logger module for detailed error messages.
